data: PED SUS buprenorphine-naloxone (Suboxone) Rapid Microdosing Induction
Admit/Transfer/Discharge
Ensure PED Acute Opioid Withdrawal PowerPlan has been ordered prior to completing this PowerPlan

Buprenorphine is an opioid and providers should be familiar with College of Physicians and Surgeons of BC Practice Standards on Safe Prescribing of Opioids and Sedatives and BC Centre for Substance Use Guidelines on Treatment of Opioid Use Disorder
Microdosing allows patients to be started on buprenorphine-naloxone (Suboxone) while concurrently using opioids and thus does not require waiting until withdrawal symptoms occur

Providers may alternatively consider the PED SUS Buprenorphine-Naloxone (Suboxone) Standard Induction PowerPlan for patients in moderate to severe withdrawal OR who are at low risk for precipitated withdrawal
Patient Care
Clinical Opiate Withdrawal Scale

First 72 hours: Assess subjective cravings or withdrawal symptoms, using COWS scoring if possible, prior to providing each dose of buprenorphine-naloxone, q30min for 1 hour after each dose and q2h while awake
Notify Treating Provider

Notify provider immediately if COWS score increases or patient reports worsening withdrawal after receiving buprenorphine-naloxone. Or if withdrawal symptoms are not adequately managed with medication
Clinical Opiate Withdrawal Scale
After 72 hours: Document COWS with vital signs
Medications
Ensure prior Hydromorphone order has been reviewed
Hydromorphone usual start dose 1-3 mg, requires reassessment for correct dosing
HYDROmorphone
mg, PO, q3h, order duration: 48 hour, PRN other (see comment), drug form: tab
buprenorphine-naloxone 2 mg-0.5 mg tab (dosed as buprenorphine)
0.5 mg, sublingual, q3h interval, order duration: 24 hour, drug form: tab
buprenorphine-naloxone 2 mg-0.5 mg tab (dosed as buprenorphine)
1 mg, sublingual, q3h interval, order duration: 24 hour, drug form: tab
Notify Treating Provider
Notify provider if less than 6 doses of 0.5 mg suboxone given in the first 24 hours and/or less then 6 doses of 1 mg suboxone given in the second 24 hours
buprenorphine-naloxone 8 mg-2 mg tab (dosed as buprenorphine)
8 mg, sublingual, qdaily, drug form: tab
buprenorphine-naloxone 2 mg-0.5 mg tab (dosed as buprenorphine)
2 mg, sublingual, q2h, PRN other (see comment), drug form: tab

On day 4: Provider to write a new order for buprenorphine-naloxone daily with dose equal to the total amount of buprenorphine-naloxone administered on the previous day using the PED SUS Buprenorphine-Naloxone (Suboxone) Subsequent Days Standard Induction PowerPlan. Provider to stop buprenorphine-naloxone PRN dosing once total daily dose is stable (typically day 4)
